newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Yeltsin feels surprisingly good - Kremlin.
newsitem.headline: Yeltsin feels surprisingly good - Kremlin.

text.p: Russian President Boris Yeltsin feels better than his doctors had expected after his bypass operation, his press secretary said on Wednesday.
"He surprises doctors with his good state," Sergei Yastrzhembsky said by telephone from his Kremlin office. "He feels quite well for this stage."

Yastrzhembsky also said Yeltsin signed a decree at 6 a.m. (0300 GMT) saying he was taking back the presidential powers he transferred to Prime Minister Viktor Chernomyrdin for the period of his heart operation.
The doctors who operated on Yeltsin were due to meet at 9 a.m. (0600 GMT) to review his progress.
Yeltsin, 65, recovered consciousness on Tuesday evening after the quintuple bypass operation, which lasted seven hours.
It was not clear whether the doctors had yet taken him off a ventilator.
